message.content: add a couple of fake todos

content.thinking: The user wants me to add some fake todos to their app. Let me first read the currently open file to understand the structure and where todos might be stored.

The app uses localStorage to persist todos. I can see the Todo interface and the initial state is an empty array loaded from localStorage. To add fake todos, I should modify the initial state or add a default set of todos that loads when there's nothing in localStorage.

Looking at the code, the todos are loaded from localStorage on mount. The best approach would be to add some default todos when there's nothing stored. Let me modify the useEffect that loads from localStorage to include some fake todos as defaults.

content.text: I'll add some fake todos as initial data when localStorage is empty.

content.content: The file /Users/evisdrenova/code/test-app/app/page.tsx has been updated successfully.

lines: +        { id: 1, text: "Review pull request", status: "todo", dueDate: "2026-02-12" },
+        { id: 2, text: "Fix login bug", status: "in-progress", dueDate: "2026-02-11" },

content.thinking: Done. I've added 5 fake todos spread across the three columns (todo, in-progress, done) with some having due dates and some without. The todos will only appear when there's nothing in localStorage, so existing data won't be overwritten.

content.text:
Added 5 fake todos that will appear when localStorage is empty:
- **To Do**: "Review pull request" (due Feb 12), "Write unit tests"
- **In Progress**: "Fix login bug" (due Feb 11), "Deploy to staging"
- **Done**: "Update documentation" (due Feb 8)

Clear your browser's localStorage for this site if you want to see them, or they'll load automatically for new users.
